meanings.definition: A structure, such as a turret or cupola, designed to command a view.
meanings.sent1: The belvederes on top of the castle allowed the princess to see the entire kingdom.
meanings.sent2: From the belvederes of the mansion, you could see the rolling hills in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The belvederes at the park were so high that birds often mistook them for trees!
meanings.sent4: The belvederes of the city hall stood tall like watchful guardians over the bustling streets.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the belvederes glowed with the last rays of light, creating a magical sight.

meanings.definition: A summerhouse or open-sided gallery, usually at rooftop level, commanding a view.
meanings.sent1: The family enjoyed picnics in the belvederes overlooking the ocean.
meanings.sent2: Visitors often gathered in the belvederes to admire the sunset over the horizon.
meanings.sent3: The belvederes were the perfect spot for a game of hide-and-seek during the summer.
meanings.sent4: The belvederes seemed to reach up and touch the sky, as if trying to grasp the clouds.
meanings.sent5: The artist found inspiration in the belvederes, capturing their beauty on canvas.
